title: Revealed: How ITV brings the Rugby World Cup to your living room - 3am alarm calls, a fake bonsai tree and matching socks
text:
In ITV’s Rugby World Cup ‘dojo’ studio, with its pastel cityscape views, red paper lanterns, cherry blossom and wooden Japanese architecture, time is precious. The bonsai tree is a fake. A pair of hands cannot be spared to water a real one in this fast-paced hive of activity where decisions, hatched in a matter of nanoseconds, are dictated by the action on the pitch.

And yet, as England kicked off against Argentina, the overriding feeling was one of serenity - maybe that studio decoration does have an effect. The air was icy, a deliberate tactic to keep skin mattified under the studio lights. Lawrence Dallaglio chewed on his pen. Jonny Wilkinson chomped on an apple from the fruit bowl laid on...
